com.actinarium.rhythm

Class SimpleArgumentsBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.actinarium.rhythm.SimpleArgumentsBundle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArgumentsBundle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle

    public class SimpleArgumentsBundle
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArgumentsBundle
    A basic implementation of ArgumentsBundle, which stores all arguments simply as a String->String key-value map and parses them into required types when accessed by respective getter methods (meaning it also fails lazily). Does not cache parsing results, so if the same arguments are requested multiple times, it may be a good idea to query them once and store the result in a variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleArgumentsBundle

        public SimpleArgumentsBundle(@NonNull
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> arguments,
                             @NonNull
                             android.util.DisplayMetrics metrics)
        Create a new simple arguments bundle implementation from provided key->value map.
        Parameters:
        arguments - A collection that maps arguments to values. In this implementation both the key and the value are raw strings, parsed into required data types as requested from the map. The values must be already provided as parsable literal values — this implementation cannot resolve variables or calculate expressions.
        For performance reasons, this map will be used as is, therefore it must not be mutated. Furthermore this implementation lacks methods to put new parameters into the bag.
        metrics - Display metrics associated with this arguments bundle, required so that dimension values (dp, sp etc) can be properly resolved.

      • resolveArgument

        protected java.lang.String resolveArgument(java.lang.String key)
        Resolves argument value from the bundle. This implementation simply returns the raw string as put in the argument map by the inflater. Used internally by all getXxx() methods — subclasses should override this method if additional processing is required (e.g. lazy variable dereference, expression evaluation etc).
        Parameters:
        key - key of the argument whose value to resolve
        Returns:
        string representation of the value

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
        Get argument value as a string. For simple arguments bundle, will return the raw string as put in the arguments map by the inflater. If you need to change how raw value is resolved, override resolveArgument(String)
        Specified by:
        getString in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        Returns:
        argument value as a string, or null if the argument has null value or it cannot be retrieved

      • getDimensionUnits

        public int getDimensionUnits(java.lang.String key)
        Get the units of a dimension argument. Note: this is a very crude implementation relying only on the check of trailing string characters (i.e. whether the string ends with "dp", "px", "%" etc). However, for development-time library and assuming that developers are not their own enemies, that should be fine.
        Specified by:
        getDimensionUnits in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        Returns:
        dimension argument units, or ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_NULL if the argument is null or missing

      • getDimensionValue

                               float defaultValue)
        Get raw numeric value from dimension argument disregarding units and NOT performing any conversion to pixels.
        Specified by:

        dimension argument raw value
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelRaw(float, int, DisplayMetrics)

      • getDimensionPixelExact

        public float getDimensionPixelExact(java.lang.String key,
                                    float defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike ArgumentsBundle.getDimensionPixelSize(String, int) and ArgumentsBundle.getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), this method doesn't perform any rounding. Note: this method requires that DisplayMetrics object is injected in this config.
        Specified by:
        getDimensionPixelExact in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelRaw(float, int, DisplayMetrics)

      • getDimensionPixelOffset

        public int getDimensionPixelOffset(java.lang.String key,
                                   int defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike ArgumentsBundle.getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), this method is expected to round the raw value down to the closest integer. Note: this method requires that DisplayMetrics object is injected in this config.
        Specified by:
        getDimensionPixelOffset in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelRaw(float, int, DisplayMetrics)

      • getDimensionPixelSize

        public int getDimensionPixelSize(java.lang.String key,
                                 int defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike ArgumentsBundle.getDimensionPixelOffset(String, int)}, this method is expected to round the raw value up or down to the closest integer by common rules, and must ensure the result is at least 1px if original value is not 0. Note: this method requires that DisplayMetrics object is injected in this config.
        Specified by:
        getDimensionPixelSize in interface ArgumentsBundle
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelRaw(float, int, DisplayMetrics)

      • getDimensionPixelRaw

        public static float getDimensionPixelRaw(float value,
                                         int units,
                                         android.util.DisplayMetrics metrics)
        Convert complex dimension value of provided units into pixels.
        Parameters:
        value - raw dimension value, e.g. 24f
        units - dimension units, one of ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_PX, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_DP, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_SP, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_PT, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_IN, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_MM, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_NUMBER, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_NULL, or ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_PERCENT
        metrics - display metrics to convert complex dimension types that depend on density (dp, sp etc) into pixels, can be null if type is one of ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_PX, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_PERCENT, ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_NUMBER, or ArgumentsBundle.UNITS_NULL
        Returns:
        dimension value in pixels
